Database Bibliography Tasks
Answering Queries Using Views: A Survey. Alon Y. Levy. Department of Computer Science and Engineering. University of Washington. Seattle, WA, 98195
MiniCon: A scalable algorithm for answering queries using views, R. Pottinger, A. Havely, The VLDB Journal The International Journal on Very Large Data Bases, 2001
Data Integration A Theoretical Perspective, Maurizio Lenzerini, Procs of 21 ACM SIGMOD-SIGACT-SIGART symposium on Principles of database systems, 2002
Efficiently Ordering Query Plans for Data Integration, AnHai Doan and Alon Havely, Procs of the international conference on data engineering, 2002
Query Containment for Data Integration Systems, Millstein T. and Halevy A. and Friedman M., Journal of Computer and System sciences, 2003
Reasoning in Data Integration Systems: why LAV and GAV are Siblings, Andrea Cali, ISMIS 2003, Maebashi City, Japan.
Bootstraping Pay-As-You-Go Data Integration Systems Anish Das Sarma, Xin Dong, Alon Halevy, SIGMOD 2008
Reconcilable Differences, Todd J. Green, Zachary G. Ives, Val Tannen, ICDT 2009.
Optimizing queries across diverse data sources, L. M. Haas, D. Kossmann, E. L. Wimmers, and J. Yang In Proc. VLDB, pages 276–285, Athens, Greece, Aug. 1997.
Query Planning in InfoMaster, O.M. Duschka, M.R. Genesereth, 12th ACM Symposium on Applied Computing, San Jose, CA, 1997.
Flexible and scalable query planning in distributed and heterogeneous environments, Jos? Luis Ambite and Craig A. Knoblock, In The Fourth International Conference on Artificial Intelligence Planning Systems (AIPS-98), Pittsburgh, June, 1998.
Query Processing and Optimization on the Web, Mourad Ouzzani, Athman Bouguettaya, Dept of Computer Science, Virginia Tech, Distributed and Parallel Databases, 15, 187-218, 2004.
Adaptive Query Processing: Technology in Evolution, Joseph M. Hellerstein, Michael J. Franklin, Sirish Chandrasekaran, Amol Deshpande, Kris Hildrum, Sam Madden, Vijayshankar Raman and Mehul A. Shah, Special issue on Adaptive Query Processing, 23(2), December 1993
XJoin: A Reactively-Scheduled Pipelined Join Operator, Tolga Urhan and Michael J. Franklin,

PhD thesis Tasks

Prepare system for ESWC 2011: make the system public for accessing bio2rdf endpoints. Fail proof. It is important to get similar results to the ones in the paper. Fail proof: clean code, default graph problem, remove patterns {}, etc.
